TEI.2.document_title: Richard Ellis to Stephen F. Austin, 01-03-1828

barker_notes.barker_summary: Richard Ellis to Austin, Tuseumbia, Ala., January 3, 1828. Agriculture depressed by tariff and taxes. Fifty families ready to emigrate to Texas if allowed to introduce their slaves.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: The end of the letter is missing. The writer can be identified by Fuqua to Austin, Mar. 28 1828
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 2-5

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Richard Ellis to Austin, Tuseumbia, Ala., January 3, 1828. Agriculture depressed by tariff and taxes. Fifty families ready to emigrate to Texas if allowed to introduce their slaves.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*State of Alabama*/location_mentioned**/p* *p**location_mentioned*Town of Tuscumbia*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="01-03-1828">3rd Jany. 1828*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*D. Colo*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*I beg leave to introduce to your aquantence and notice *person_mentioned*Mr Silus, Ephram*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Benjmn Fuqua*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Mr Job Ingram*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Kye Ingram*/person_mentioned*, these *person_mentioned*Gentlemen */person_mentioned*have emigrated to your *location_mentioned*Coloney */location_mentioned*to become permanent *person_mentioned*settlers*/person_mentioned*—The *person_mentioned*Mr Fuquas*/person_mentioned* are *person_mentioned*Mechanics*/person_mentioned*, two of them of the best kind; they are honest and respectable *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*and are determined to suport the Government to which they go, I have had much conversation with *person_mentioned*Mr Silus Fuqua*/person_mentioned*, on the present and future prospects of your *location_mentioned*coloney*/location_mentioned*; and tho he has never seen it, he has a most corect idea of its great advantages, you will find him an inteligent man and I have no doubt will be an acquisition to your *location_mentioned*Setlement*/location_mentioned*, I have known these *person_mentioned*gentlemen */person_mentioned*twelve years, the *person_mentioned*Mr Ingrains*/person_mentioned* I have not known personaly but from their universal good character and the *person_mentioned*Gentlemen */person_mentioned*they go with, I feel no hesitation to recomend them to your attention;*/p*
*p*On my arival in the*location_mentioned* U. S.*/location_mentioned* I found Agriculture fast declining in all the *location_mentioned*Middle and Southern region of our country,*/location_mentioned* oppressed with heavey duties on imports from a broad and taxes at *location_mentioned*home*/location_mentioned*, and the *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*burthened with debts, many of which were no doubt contracted in more prosperous times that I could not help runing a parallel in my mind between the happy condition of the *person_mentioned*adopted citizens */person_mentioned*of your *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and the people of this; indeed frankness and candure impels me not to withold from you the expressions of the opinions and thoughts that have so repetedly obtruded themselves on my mind; (that is) that every *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*ought to bless his happy star that conduced them to a *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*blessed with the finest soil in *location_mentioned*North Amarica*/location_mentioned*, with plenty, health, peace and happiness— and if they act wisely (as I hope and trust they will) they will foster and cherish the Government they live in, which will be the certain means of preserving their estamible rights unimpaired; and a sure protection of their property—while on the contrary in this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*there are hundreds and thousands of *person_mentioned*familes */person_mentioned*who do not own a foot of land nor have they any hope of ever doing so (I mean of any real value) who are barely able to sustain themselves with the most common coarse food and raiment—In the short time since my arival at home I have assertained beyond question that 40 or 50 *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*would emigrate with me *date_mentioned n="Fall - 1829">next fall*/date_mentioned* to your *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*if they could introduce their *person_mentioned*slaves*/person_mentioned*, many of them are *person_mentioned*large holders*/person_mentioned* of that description of *person_mentioned*property*/person_mentioned*; and I consider it a duty I owe myself as well as you, to assure you that I shall moove to your *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*next *date_mentioned n="Fall- 1829">fall */date_mentioned*if I can with safety bring mine; for I find I have not one *person_mentioned*slave*/person_mentioned* that is willing to be sold from me*/p*;
*p*I feel a deep interest in the prosperity of your *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and hope you will do me the favour (for I shall prise it highly) to write to me by the *person_mentioned*first safe hand*/person_mentioned* after the receipt of this letter; let me know if we will be alowed to bring in *person_mentioned*Slaves */person_mentioned*under any circumstances, if not what are the future prospects—what has been done with my petition, can I locate the *location_mentioned*Heseandar */location_mentioned*[hacienda] *location_mentioned*on the west bank of the colorado River*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*If I can bring in fifty *person_mentioned*families*/person_mentioned*, I believe I can get $50. a *location_mentioned*League*/location_mentioned* from them, and I should give you one half if you will reserve good land for them as I have always thought that compensation not enough for the *person_mentioned*founder of a colony*/person_mentioned* in adition to his *location_mentioned*premium lands*/location_mentioned*— but this will depend on the *person_mentioned*Slave */person_mentioned*Question can *location_mentioned*fifty good Leagues be got between the colorado and auroyo lavaca—*/location_mentioned*that is now vacant— I know when you reach home how much you will be provoked and how much you will (on many acounts) regret the deception and fraud played off on me and many respectable *person_mentioned*citizens */person_mentioned*of your *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned* by *person_mentioned*William Pettus*/person_mentioned*—for he even sold my *person_mentioned*boddy servant*/person_mentioned* and did not take (perhaps) a dollar with him to the *location_mentioned*Rio Grande*/location_mentioned* to purchase Mules for me, for his *person_mentioned*wife */person_mentioned*said in my presens she allways blamed him for not carring the money with him; nor have I received one cent for the fine mar I caried to that *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*for all he paid me dos not even pay the interest upon the debt—I paid for him as an inocent security Such an abuse of confidence, and once I admit friendship; proves beyond the most remote possibility of a doubt, a dereliction of all honourable principal and a depravity of hart that can never be reclaimed nor reformed, I believe I might use the same language to you *person_mentioned*Sir John Falstaff*/person_mentioned* did to *person_mentioned*prince Henry*/person_mentioned* (of *location_mentioned*Poins*/location_mentioned*) "he is the most omnipotent *person_mentioned*villain */person_mentioned*that ever cried stand to a true man's what he has done with all the property, goods and money, he had*/p*
*p*[Richard Ellis.]*/p*
*/div1*
